text: Hege Hansen (born 24 October 1990) is a Norwegian footballer who plays for Klepp IL in the Norwegian Toppserien and for Norway. ==Career== Her father Hugo Hansen and Cato Hansen were both professional footballers. Hansen played from 2006 to 2010 for the Toppserien club Klepp IL. In August 2010, she switched to Arna-Bjørnar and her first match for new club, was against her old club. After five seasons, she returned to Klepp IL for 2015 season. ==International career== Hansen was in several Norwegian junior teams. In autumn 2007, she was part of the U-19 team that qualified and reached the final in the 2008 UEFA Women's Under-19 Championship in France. They were runners-up, after losing to Italy, for the minimum score, 1:0. She also participated in the team that played the 2009 UEFA Women's Under-19 Championship. Norway qualified for the final tournament, but was unable to surpass the group stage and only scored once. In February 2009, she played two matches for the U-23 team in La Manga, Spain. Three years later, on 17 January 2012 – also in La Manga – she played her first game for the senior team. On 14 May 2015, she was nominated for the final squad for the 2015 FIFA Women's World Cup. ==References== ==External links== * Team`s Player profile * Eurosport Player profile * NFF Player Profile Category:1990 births Category:Living people Category:People from Time, Norway Category:Women's association football forwards Category:Klepp IL players Category:Arna-Bjørnar players Category:Avaldsnes IL players Category:Toppserien players Category:2015 FIFA Women's World Cup players Category:Norway women's international footballers Category:Norwegian women's footballers
title: Hege Hansen
